intro: Gnaphalium sodiroi, commonly known as the slender cudweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Gnaphalium sodiroi is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological importance as a food source for various insects.
